00010 #include "Jamoma.h"

00012 
00013 // Data Structure for this object
00014 typedef struct _remote{
00015         t_jcom_core_subscriber_common   common;
00016         void                                                    *outlet;
00017         void                                                    *dumpout;       
00018         t_atom                                                  output[512];    
00019         short                                                   output_len;
00020         method                                                  callback;               
00021         t_object                                                *callbackArg;   
00022 } t_remote;
00023 
00024 
00025 // Prototypes for methods
00026 void *remote_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);                 // New Object Creation Method
00027 void remote_assist(t_remote *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);              // Assistance Method
00028 void remote_dispatched(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00029 void remote_jit_matrix(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00030 void remote_send_feedback(t_remote *x);
00031 void remote_int(t_remote *x, long value);
00032 void remote_float(t_remote *x, double value);
00033 void remote_symbol(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00034 void remote_list(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00035 void remote_setcallback(t_remote *x, method newCallback, t_object *callbackArg);
00036 void remote_subscribe(t_remote *x);

00039 // Globals
00040 t_class         *remote_class;                                  // Required. Global pointing to this class
00041 
00042 
00043 /************************************************************************************/
00044 // Main() Function
00045 
00046 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00047 {
00048         t_class         *c;
00049         t_object        *attr;
00050         long            offset;
00051         
00052         jamoma_init();
00053 
00054         // Define our class
00055         c = class_new("jcom.remote",(method)remote_new, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_common_free, 
00056                 (short)sizeof(t_remote), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00057         offset = calcoffset(t_remote, common);
00058         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00059 
00060         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_dispatched,           "dispatched",   A_GIMME, 0L);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_jit_matrix,           "jit_matrix",   A_GIMME, 0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_int,                          "int",                  A_DEFLONG,      0L);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_float,                        "float",                A_DEFFLOAT,     0L);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_list,                         "list",                 A_GIMME, 0L);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_symbol,                       "anything",             A_GIMME, 0L);
00067     class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_assist,                   "assist",               A_CANT, 0L);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)remote_setcallback,          "setcallback",  A_CANT, 0);
00069 
00070         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset); 
00071                 
00072         // Finalize our class
00073         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00074         remote_class = c;
00075 
00076         return 0;
00077 }
00078 
00079 
00080 /************************************************************************************/
00081 // Object Life
00082 
00083 // Create
00084 void *remote_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00085 {
00086         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);               // support normal arguments
00087         t_remote        *x = (t_remote *)object_alloc(remote_class);
00088         t_symbol        *name = _sym_nothing;   
00089         
00090         if(attrstart && argv)
00091                 atom_arg_getsym(&name, 0, attrstart, argv);
00092         else
00093                 name = symbol_unique();
00094         
00095         if(x){
00096                 x->dumpout = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00097                 x->outlet = outlet_new(x, NULL);
00098                 object_obex_store((void *)x, ps_dumpout, (object *)x->dumpout);         // setup the dumpout
00099 
00100                 atom_setsym(&x->output[0], name);
00101                 x->output_len = 1;
00102 
00103                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_remote);
00104                 jcom_core_subscriber_setcustomsubscribe_method(&x->common, (t_subscribe_method)remote_subscribe);
00105 
00106                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                                       // handle attribute args                                
00107                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00108         }
00109         return (x);                                                                                             // Return the pointer
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 /************************************************************************************/
00114 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00115 
00116 // Method for Assistance Messages
00117 void remote_assist(t_remote *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00118 {
00119         if(msg==1)      // Inlets
00120                 strcpy(dst, "private messages to send to the hub");
00121         else if(msg==2){ // Outlets
00122                 if(arg == 0) strcpy(dst, "private messages from the hub");
00123                 else strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00124         }
00125 }
00126 
00127 
00128 // this method is called when we have subscribed to the hub
00129 void remote_subscribe(t_remote *x)
00130 {
00131         if(x->callback)
00132                 x->callback(x->callbackArg, ps_subscribe, 0, NULL);
00133 }
00134 
00135 
00136 // messages received from jcom.hub
00137 void remote_dispatched(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00138 {
00139         outlet_anything(x->outlet, atom_getsym(argv), argc-1, argv+1);
00140         if(x->callback)
00141                 x->callback(x->callbackArg, x->common.attr_name, argc, argv);
00142 }
00143 
00144 
00145 // messages received from jcom.out
00146 void remote_jit_matrix(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00147 {
00148         outlet_anything(x->outlet, msg, argc, argv);
00149 }
00150 
00151 
00152 // remote values to the hub
00153 void remote_send_private(t_remote *x)
00154 {
00155         object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_private, x->output_len, x->output, NULL);
00156         x->output_len = 1;      // truncate to just the name of this jcom.remote object
00157 }
00158 
00159 
00160 // INT INPUT
00161 void remote_int(t_remote *x, long value)
00162 {
00163         atom_setlong(&x->output[1], value);
00164         x->output_len = 2;
00165         remote_send_private(x);
00166 }
00167 
00168 
00169 // FLOAT INPUT
00170 void remote_float(t_remote *x, double value)
00171 {
00172         atom_setfloat(&x->output[1], value);
00173         x->output_len = 2;
00174         remote_send_private(x);
00175 }
00176 
00177 
00178 // SYMBOL INPUT
00179 void remote_symbol(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00180 {
00181         short i;
00182 
00183         atom_setsym(&x->output[1], msg);
00184         x->output_len++;
00185         
00186         for(i=1; i<=argc; i++){
00187                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->output[i+1], argv++);
00188                 x->output_len++;
00189         }       
00190         
00191         remote_send_private(x);
00192 }
00193 
00194 
00195 // LIST INPUT 
00196 void remote_list(t_remote *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00197 {
00198         short i;
00199         
00200         for(i=1; i<=argc; i++){
00201                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->output[i], argv++);
00202                 x->output_len++;
00203         }
00204         remote_send_private(x);
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 void remote_setcallback(t_remote *x, method newCallback, t_object *callbackArg)
00209 {
00210         x->callback = newCallback;
00211         x->callbackArg = callbackArg;
00212 }
